event: After creating Beyonce's own management company Parkwood Entertainment, Beyonce achieved acclaim for releasing the sonically experimental visual albums Beyonce (2013) and Lemonade (2016), which explored multiple societal themes such as feminism, relationships and womanism.
Name: Beyonce

event: Outside of music, Beyonce has starred as an actress in multiple films such as Austin Powers in Goldmember (2002), The Pink Panther (2006), Dreamgirls (2006), Cadillac Records (2008), Obsessed (2009), and The Lion King (2019).Having sold over 200 million records worldwide, Beyonce is one of the best-selling music artists of all time.
Name: Beyonce

event: Beyonce was born on September 4, 1981, in Houston, Texas, to Celestine "Tina" Knowles (née Beyonce), a hairdresser and salon owner, and Mathew Knowles, a Xerox sales manager.
Name: Beyonce

event: Beyonce changed Beyonce's name to Destiny's Child in 1996, based upon a passage in the Book of Isaiah.
Name: Beyonce

event: In April 2007, Beyonce embarked on The Beyonce Experience, Beyonce's first worldwide concert tour, visiting 97 venues and grossed over $24 million.[note 1]
Name: Beyonce

event: In March 2009, Beyonce embarked on the I Am... Tour, Beyonce's second headlining worldwide concert tour, consisting of 108 shows, grossing $119.5 million.[0
Name: Beyonce

event: Beyonce donated Beyonce's entire salary from the 2008 musical biopic Cadillac Records to Phoenix House, an organization of rehabilitation centers for heroin addicts around the United States.
Name: Beyonce

event: In 2010, Beyonce was featured on Lady Gaga's single "Telephone" and appeared in Lady Gaga's single "Telephone"'s music video.
Name: Beyonce

event: As of November 2014[update], Beyonce has sold over 5 million copies worldwide and has generated over 1 billion streams, as of March 20142015[update].At the 57th Annual Grammy Awards in February 2015, Beyonce was nominated for six awards, ultimately winning three: Best R&B Performance and Best R&B Song for The single "Drunk in Love", featuring Jay-Z,, and Best Surround Sound Album for Beyonce. Beyonce was nominated for Album of the Year, but Album of the Year went to Beck for Beck's album Morning Phase.
Name: Beyonce

event: Beyonce is featured on the remake The Lion King, which was released in July 2019's , with a remake of the song "Can You Feel the Love Tonight" alongside Donald Glover, Billy Eichner and Seth Rogen, which was originally composed by Elton John.
category2: 2019–2021: Homecoming, The Lion King and Black Is King
Name: Beyonce

event: In April of 2020, Beyonce was featured on the remix of Megan Thee Stallion's song "Savage", marking Beyonce's first material of music for 2020.
category2: 2019–2021: Homecoming, The Lion King and Black Is King
Name: Beyonce

event: Beyonce paid homage to Anita Baker by performing "Déjà Vu" at the 2006 Fashion Rocks concert wearing Anita Baker's trademark mini-hula skirt embellished with fake bananas.
Name: Beyonce

event: However, Beyonce announced in May 2012 that Beyonce would bring the alter ego "Sasha Fierce" back for Beyonce's Revel Presents: Beyoncé Live shows later that month.
Name: Beyonce

event: Beyonce was named the "World's Most Beautiful Woman" by People and the "Hottest Female Singer of All Time" by Complex in 2012.
Name: Beyonce

event: In 2007, Beyonce was featured on the cover of the Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Issue, becoming the second African American woman after Tyra Banks, and People magazine recognized Beyonce as the best-dressed celebrity.Beyonce has been named "Queen Bey" from publications over the years.
Name: Beyonce

event: Beyonce wrote of her pregnancy and her pregnancy's aftermath in the September 2018 issue of Vogue, in which Beyonce had full control of the cover, shot at Hammerwood Park by photographer Tyler Mitchell.
Name: Beyonce

event: Beyonce performed "America the Beautiful" at President Barack Obama's's 2009 presidential inauguration, as well as "At Last" during the first inaugural dance at the Neighborhood Ball two days later.
Name: Beyonce

event: Beyonce also headlined for 2016 presidential nominee Hillary Clinton in a concert held the weekend before Election Day the next year.
Name: Beyonce

event: In a concert held the weekend before Election Day the next year, Beyonce and her entourage of backup dancers wore pantsuits; a clear allusion to 2016 presidential nominee Hillary Clinton's frequent dress-of-choice.
Name: Beyonce

event: Beyonce would later align Beyonce more publicly with the movement, sampling "We should all be feminists", a speech delivered by Nigerian author Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie at a TEDx talk in April 2013, in Beyonce's song "Flawless", released later that year.
Name: Beyonce

event: Beyonce publicly endorsed same-sex marriage on March 26, 2013, after the Supreme Court debate on California's Proposition 8.
Name: Beyonce

event: In a 2016 interview with Elle, Beyonce responded to the controversy surrounding Beyonce's song "Formation" which was perceived to be critical of the police.
Name: Beyonce

event: 2013, Beyonce was published as the fourth most-powerful celebrity in the Forbes magazine rankings.
Name: Beyonce

event: , Alex Suskind noticed how Beyonce was the decade's's (2010s) defining pop star, stating that "no one dominated music in the decade's like Beyonce", explaining that Beyonce's "songs, album rollouts, stage presence, social justice initiatives, and disruptive public relations strategy have influenced the way we've viewed music since 2010."
Name: Beyonce

event: In 2004 and 2019, Beyonce received NAACP Image Award for Entertainer of the Year and the Soul Train Music Award for Sammy Davis Jr. – Entertainer of the Year.
Name: Beyonce

event: In 2005, Beyonce also received APEX Award at the Trumpet Award honoring the achievements of Black African Americans.
Name: Beyonce

event: Beyonce received the Michael Jackson Video Vanguard Award at the 2014 MTV Video Music Awards and was honored as Honorary Mother of the Year at the Australian Mother of the Year Award in Barnardo's Australia for Beyonce's Humanitarian Effort in the region and the Council of Fashion Designers of America Fashion Icon Award in 2016.
Name: Beyonce

event: In 2020, Beyonce was awarded the BET Humanitarian Award.
Name: Beyonce

event: Beyonce won two awards at the Broadcast Film Critics Association Awards 2006; Best Song for "Listen" and Best Original Soundtrack for Dreamgirls: Music from the Motion Picture.
Name: Beyonce

event: On June 17, 2021, Beyonce was inducted into the Black Music & Entertainment Walk of Fame as a member of the inaugural class.
Name: Beyonce

event: Beyonce has worked with Pepsi since 2002, and in 2004 appeared in a Gladiator-themed commercial with Britney Spears, Pink, and Enrique Iglesias.
Name: Beyonce

event: Beyonce also has had deals with American Express, Nintendo DS and L'Oréal since the age of 18.In March 2015
Name: Beyonce

event: In 2005, Beyonce teamed up with House of Brands, a shoe company, to produce a range of footwear for House of Deréon, a contemporary women's fashion line.
Name: Beyonce

event: Deréon by Beyoncé was previewed on the upcoming Elle January 2020 issue, where Beyonce is seen wearing several garments, accessories and footwear from the first collection.
Name: Beyonce

event: As of 2016, Beyonce had donated $7 million for the maintenance of the Knowles-Temenos Place Apartments, a housing complex offering living space for 43 displaced individuals.
Name: Beyonce

event: Beyonce additionally donated $75,000 worth of new mattresses to survivors of Hurricane Harvey in August 2017.
Name: Beyonce
